data.title: The Towering Inferno Soundtrack
data.meta_description: This is such a classic movie. An absolutely fantastic film with a great cast
data.text:
Next up for John Williams, in our month of #Johnuary, is his next big movie score which happened to be the next big disaster hit from Irwin Allen again – The Towering Inferno.

This is such a classic movie. An absolutely fantastic film with a great cast – Steve McQueen, Paul Newman, Faye Dunaway, Fred Astaire, Richard Chamberlain, O.J. Simpson, Robert Vaughn, Robert Wagner, Dabney Coleman and many more. Great film.

Here is the main title…

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fUpqrgaVxJ8

And here is a playlist of the full soundtrack…

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fUpqrgaVxJ8&index=1&list=PLInG6q04i5X14iPiR8lfQXjGGdrTNc_77

The main theme comes across as very urgent and dramatic. I really liked it. Part of it almost sounds Western in places which seems apt when Steve McQueen and Paul Newman are the male leads

The track ‘Trapped Lovers’ kind of sounds like a fire alarm, which is quite clever given the context

‘Let There Be Light’ – great name for a track this movie

‘Planting the Charges’ has some great rousing dramatic moments.

A bit like The Poseidon Adventure soundtrack there’s nothing hugely memorable here to listen to on its own but it’s all extremely powerful stuff which obviously adds a huge amount to a dramatic movie like this. Next time I watch the full film I’ll be paying extra attention to the score throughout and the part that it plays.
